channel.title: The Best Way Of Advertising ($100)
channel.description:
Hoping that everything goes fine and dandy, Google ought to be paying me soon, which means I'll have 100USD to spend on Spiced-FX. I'm not interested in using it for personal use.
Anyway, the website, in all honesty, kicked off pretty well. It was released Saturday night, and already our traffic is 3GB with 1044+ visits. I am, however, interested in trying to make it something semi-successful, as the site is based on graphics resources. So far, I've been finding and adding link after link, and have done pretty well, and it's got to the point where I need members to start submitting there packs/tutorials/resources.
The only way to do/get the above is to get more members, and I'm not interested in the cheap sneeky advertising on sites like this which have nothing to do with Graphics, but more professional advertising on graphical sites.
Now, I have a few choices: 1. Personally ask the site for my banner to be displayed for a certain amount of hits/clicks and agree on a fixed price. 2. Get advertising through Google AdSense. The only problem with that is a lot of people ignore or just block the ads completely. 3. Other - That's where you come in.
So, yeh, that's it :)
I know you lot wont let me done, so I'll thank you now ;) <3

item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:6, topic:83963”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=123361.msg1206359#msg1206359 date=1177378644]

  1. Get advertising through Google AdSense. The only problem with that is a lot of people ignore or just block the ads completely.

I am not 100% sure on how it works, but I know you pay by click, so I don’t think it costs you unless people actually click on the link and visit your site. Plus it would only be advertised on pages with relevant content. If I was going to advertise that is probably how I would do it.
[/quote]

If I recall, it’s per view, I was thinking of advertising an image here at moparisthebest.com for a joke, redirecting to www.moparisthebest.com/smf but it was something like $35 for 1k views.[/quote]

Maybe they have a option for that I don’t know, but usually you have to pay 5 cents(or more if you choose) per click.
